job.title: Junior Software Engineer
job.industry: Information Technology and Services,Higher Education,Computer Software
job.description: Company DescriptionAs a national nonprofit focused on closing the tech talent gap, LaunchCode is working with this partner to create a special on-ramp program for people who have the skills to work in technology, but just need an opportunity.Come and join us to start your tech journey. Apply to be considered today!We only accept applications through our website (https://www.launchcode.org/job-postings/saint-louis/junior-software-developer).Job DescriptionWe only accept applications through our website (https://www.launchcode.org/job-postings/saint-louis/junior-software-developer).QualificationsWe're Looking For Candidates Who Have:The passion drive and aptitude to succeed in technology.Tech skills to build a project with one of the following languages:Java, with bonus points for Spring MVC or the Android platformJavaScript, with bonus points for Angular, React, Vue, or NodePython, with bonus points for DjangoPHPC#.NETSwift for iOS applicationsC or C++Ruby on RailsA completed project or portfolio of work to showcase to employers.The ability to work full-time in the United States.What We OfferCompensation of $15-20 per hourHealth Insurance and other benefitsMentorship from an experienced programmerAn opportunity to fast-track the standard IT hiring experience for Junior Software DevelopersWe only accept applications through our website (https://www.launchcode.org/job-postings/saint-louis/junior-software-developer).Additional InformationWe Heart DiversityLaunchCode supports and fosters leadership from underrepresented communities. We strongly encourage folks from immigrant communities and communities of color, as well as those who identify as women, LGBTQ, or under-resourced to apply. LaunchCode is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Program and employment policies of LaunchCode are nondiscriminatory in regard to race, color, gender, religion, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation.
